Dr. Mona Savitri Jhaveri and Michael Irwin Brown are to be married today by Rabbi Ruth A. Zlotnick at the Brooklyn Museum of Art.

The bride, 34, works in the intellectual property office of the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research in Manhattan, where she helps file patents for vaccines and to license them to biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. She graduated from the State University of New York at Binghamton and received a doctorate in biochemistry from Wake Forest University.
She is a daughter of K. Pramila Vishvanath of Westport, Conn., and Aziz A. Jhaveri of Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

The bridegroom, 52, is the president of Innovative Resources Management, a Washington group that works with organizations and governments in developing countries to reduce poverty and conserve forests and wildlife. He graduated from the University of Massachusetts and received a master's degree in anthropology from the University of Wisconsin.
He is the son of the late Pearl and Arthur Brown, who lived in Boston. The bridegroom was a widower.
